title.narrative: IR 1.1.1: HEALTH SERVICES

description.narrative: 1.1.1. Most disadvantaged women, teenagers and children from the intervention areas, have access to quality maternal and child health services that are implemented through functional networks and that offer effective and culturally appropriate health care, even in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1.1. Most disadvantaged women, teenagers and children from the intervention areas, have access to quality maternal and child health services that are implemented through functional networks and that offer effective and culturally appropriate health care, even in emergency situations.
